alert.note: Alert for Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 15 at 4:48AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM EDT/515 AM CDT/ FOR SOUTHEASTERN HENRY AND NORTHEASTERN HOUSTON COUNTIES IN SOUTHEASTERN ALABAMA...WESTERN MILLER...SOUTHEASTERN CLAY...SOUTHWESTERN CALHOUN AND EARLY COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN GEORGIA... At 548 AM EDT/448 AM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Edison to 8 miles southeast of Columbia to near Ashford, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Blakely, Dothan, Ashford, Cowarts, Arlington, Webb, Columbia, Centerville, Avon, Gordon, Jakin, Bluffton, Saffold, Pansey, Parksville, Sigma, Enon, Mayhaw, Rock Hill and Barber. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
